annotate

bent.annotate.annotate(recognize=False, link=False, types={}, input_text=None, in_dir=None, ner_dir=None, input_format='brat', out_format='brat', out_dir=None, ner_model='pubmedbert', nel_model='reel_nilinker')

Pipeline to annotate text(s) with recognized entities (Named Entity and Recognition) to link them to knowledge base concepts (Named Entity Linking).

Parameters:

  • recognize (bool, optional) – specifies wether the pipeline performs Named Entity Recognition, defaults to False

  • link (bool, optional) – specifies wether the pipeline performs Named Entity Linking, defaults to False

  • types (dict, optional) – types of entities to be recognized along with the respective target knowledge bases, defaults to {}. Options: {‘disease’: ‘medic’}, {‘disease’: ‘do’}, {‘chemical’: ‘chebi’}, {‘chemical’: ‘ctd_chem’}, {‘gene’: ‘ncbi_gene’}, {‘bioprocess’: ‘go_bp’}, {‘organism’: ‘ncbi_taxon’}, {‘anatomical’: ‘uberon’}, {‘anatomical’, ‘ctd_anat’}, {‘cell_component’: ‘go_cc’}, {‘cell_line’: ‘cellosaurus’}, {‘cell_type’: ‘cell_ontology’}, {‘variant’: ‘’} {<entity_type>: <custom_knowledge_base>}

  • input_text (str or list, optional) – text string or list of text strings (each element represinting a different document) to be annotated, defaults to None

  • in_dir (_type_, optional) – path to directory containing text files to be annotated (NER and optionally NEL), defaults to None

  • ner_dir (str, optional) – directory where the output of the NER stage is located. Only applicable when there is already an output from the NER stage. Defaults to ‘None’.

  • in_format – the format of the input files. Options: ‘brat’, ‘bioc_xml’, ‘bioc_json’, ‘pubtator’

  • out_dir (str, defaults to None) – path to directory where the output of the pipeline will be located, optional. To choose current directory set out_dir==’’. If ‘out_dir’ == None (deafult) a Dataset object including all documents and respective annotations will be returned

  • out_format (str, optional) – the format of the ouput (‘brat’, None), defaults to None

  • ner_model (str, optional) – the Named Entity Recognition model that will be used, defaults to ‘pubmedbert’

  • nel_model (str, optional) – the Named Entity Linking model that will be used, defaults to ‘reel_nilinker’

Raises:

  • ValueError – if both ‘input_text’ and ‘in_dir’ are None

  • ValueError – if both ‘recognize’ and ‘link’ are None

Returns:

dataset (an object including all the input texts along with the annotations) if ‘out_dir’ is None; an annotation file for each inputed text if ‘out_dir’ is different that None

Return type:

Dataset object, text file(s)

bent.annotate.linker(recognize, types, nel_model, run_id, out_format=None, ner_dir=None, out_dir=None, dataset=None, return_dataset=False)

Pipeline to perform Named Entity Linking. For each input annotation files with recognized entities it outputs an updated annotations file (BRAT format) with knowledge base identifiers for each entity.

Parameters:

  • recognize (bool, optional) – specifies wether the pipeline performs Named Entity Recognition, defaults to False

  • types (dict, optional) – types of entities to be recognized along with the respective target knowledge bases, defaults to {}. Options: {‘disease’: ‘medic’}, {‘disease’: ‘do’}, {‘chemical’: ‘chebi’}, {‘chemical’: ‘ctd_chem’}, {‘gene’: ‘ncbi_gene’}, {‘bioprocess’: ‘go_bp’}, {‘organism’: ‘ncbi_taxon’}, {‘anatomical’: ‘uberon’}, {‘anatomical’, ‘ctd_anat’}, {‘cell_component’: ‘go_cc’}, {‘cell_line’: ‘cellosaurus’}, {‘cell_type’: ‘cell_ontology’}, {‘variant’: ‘’} {<entity_type>: <custom_knowledge_base>}

  • nel_model – the Named Entity Linking model that will be used, defaults to ‘reel_nilinker’

  • ner_dir (str, optional) – directory where the output of the NER stage is located. Only applicable when there is already an output from the NER stage. Defaults to ‘None’.

  • out_dir (str, defaults to None) – path to directory where the output of the pipeline will be located, optional. If ‘out_dir’ == None (deafult) a Dataset object including all documents and respective annotations will be returned

  • dataset (Dataset, optional) – dataset (an object including all the input texts along with the annotations from the NER stage), defaults to None

Raises:

ValueError – if ‘ner_dir’==None and recognize==False, which means that if the NER stage was not performed it is necessary nevertheless indicate the directory containing annotation files corresponding to the NER output

bent.annotate.recognizer(in_dir, entity_types, out_dir, ner_model, run_id, return_dataset=False, input_tmp=False)

Pipeline to perform Named Entity Recognition. For each input document/text it outputs either an annotations file (BRAT format) or a Dataset object including all documents and respective annotations.

Parameters:

  • in_dir (_type_, optional) – path to directory containing text files to be annotated, defaults to None

  • types – the entity types that will be recognized :type types: list

  • out_dir (str, defaults to None) – path to directory where the output of the pipeline will be located, optional. If ‘out_dir’ == None (deafult) a Dataset object including all documents and respective annotations will be returned

  • ner_model (str, optional) – the Named Entity Recognition model that will be used, defaults to ‘pubmedbert’

  • input_tmp (bool) – indicates if the input is composed of temporary text files.

Returns:

dataset (an object including all the input texts along with the annotations) if ‘out_dir’ is None; an annotation file for each inputed text if ‘out_dir’ is different that None

Return type:

Dataset object, text file(s)
